migratorynotes: "Whether late summer/fall populations are enhanced by migrants from the south is not clear."
"Some of the populations seen in summer and fall are probably migrants from farther south"
"the species is a bit migratory along the Atlantic seaboard"

overwinter notes: Some debate over whether pupae overwinter (UFL)

voltinismnotes: 2, but more data needed for Piedmont

overwinter notes: apparently larvae, but some debate over this

voltinismnotes: 2, perhaps a rudimentary third in warm autumns

source: 29th Approximation (https://auth1.dpr.ncparks.gov/nbnc/a/accounts.php); overwinter and dietbreadth (https://alabama.butterflyatlas.usf.edu/species/details/128/little-glassywing). Note possible main change

overwinter notes: do not overwinter where there are harsh winters
larvae and adults overwinter in the south

voltinismnotes: probably three, but perhaps 2 in NC

dietnotes: apparently two species, but possibly more - may be multifamily
